intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: I'm guessing we're on the right track... It's absolutely freezing out here.

intro.speaker: Flora
intro.line: Heehee. It feels great to me, but I know it's not for everyone. Just hang tight. There's a warm cabin waiting for you at the end.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Thank you, Flora. I have to commend your navigating skills as well. We've somehow managed to avoid running afoul of any Nohrian troops the whole way.

intro.speaker: Flora
intro.line: Yeah...I guess we just got lucky...

intro.speaker: Felicia
intro.line: She's right, Lord/Lady Corrin. This was just the most direct route. I would have chosen the same route if I were leading us.

intro.speaker: Flora
intro.line: Why must you always one-up me, sister? What's the point?

intro.speaker: Felicia
intro.line: What are you talking about? I'm not trying to one-up you. You're the one who's always been so perfect. I've always looked up to you.

intro.speaker: Flora
intro.line: Oh, I'm sorry. I don't know what came over me. Thank you for the kind words.

intro.speaker: Felicia
intro.line: Just don't let it go to your head, all right?

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: For the rest of the group's reference: yes, they've always been like this. *sigh*

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: What's wrong, Corrin? You haven't seemed yourself lately.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Well, to be honest...our encounter with Iago is still bothering me. I'd hate to think I can't trust everyone here, but I've been burned once before...

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: That's not your style, Corrin. You're on your way to becoming a great leader, and you lead by example. If you don't trust your own troops, how will they trust you? Don't let what happened with Zola shake your confidence.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: I don't know. I feel like things have changed. The stakes have been raised. As if they could get any higher...

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: Let's take a step back, shall we? Do you trust me, Corrin?

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Of course.

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: All right. How about Sakura and Takumi? Think about Hinoka, Azura, and Silas too. Any of them potential suspects?

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Absolutely not. I believe in all of them!

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: Very well. How can you be so sure?

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: I...I just can. I don't know. It's a gut feeling, I guess...

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: Precisely. This is both your weakness and your strength. You have a keen intuition for people and natural charisma. Yet you lack the years of experience needed to make calculated decisions. So? Follow your strength. Use your intuition. Don't try to be what you're not.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Thank you Ryoma. The problem is that my intuition is telling me that Iago wasn't lying. Regardless, I'll try to focus on the task at hand. Thank you.

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: Of course.

intro.speaker: Felicia
intro.line: Hey, guys, we're almost there!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Brr! Where's that warm cabin you promised, Flora?

intro.speaker: Flora
intro.line: Just a minute, Lord/Lady Corrin. I need to check in with the village elders.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: By all means. But please, hurry back—we're freezing out here!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Gods...I can't feel my own face. How does anyone actually LIVE here?

intro.speaker: Felicia
intro.line: Heehee! When you're born here, you never even notice how cold it is.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: The rest of us, meanwhile, could use some sweaters and a roaring fire.

intro.speaker: Felicia
intro.line: Well, hopefully Flora will be back shortly. I don't want you to think the Ice Tribe doesn't know how to treat its guests. Ah, here she is. Hey, Sister!

intro.speaker: Flora
intro.line: Ahem...

intro.speaker: Felicia
intro.line: Flora, everyone is freezing. It's adorable! But we should really get them inside so they can warm up.

intro.speaker: Flora
intro.line: Felicia...I'm sorry.

intro.speaker: Felicia
intro.line: What for?

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: It's getting even colder! And I can't see anything... What's going on?

intro.speaker: Felicia
intro.line: What are you doing, Sister? Knock it off!

intro.speaker: Flora
intro.line: I can't. I can't allow Lord/Lady Corrin to live. He/She betrayed King Garon and the kingdom of Nohr.

intro.speaker: Felicia
intro.line: You can't be serious!

intro.speaker: Jakob
intro.line: Flora, listen to reason. This is madness.

intro.speaker: Flora
intro.line: No, it is our king's will. Stand aside, Jakob, or I'll destroy you as well.

intro.speaker: Jakob
intro.line: How dare you...

intro.speaker: Flora
intro.line: Very well. If I have to kill all of you, I won't hesitate to do so. You've been warned.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: This can't be happening. Flora, are you under the direct control of King Garon or Iago? Stop this at once and rejoin us! And together we can end his hateful rule!

intro.speaker: Flora
intro.line: No. My mind is made up, and I'm acting of my own free will.

intro.speaker: Felicia
intro.line: What is wrong with you?!

intro.speaker: Flora
intro.line: Felicia... Don't worry—I won't target you. You have betrayed us as well, but I'm sure King Garon will be merciful...if you join my side right now.

intro.speaker: Felicia
intro.line: Never!

intro.speaker: Flora
intro.line: Really? Come on, Felicia. It's still me. We can do this together!

intro.speaker: Felicia
intro.line: I could never attack Lord/Lady Corrin... My job is to protect him/her!

intro.speaker: Felicia
intro.line: And I'm not the only Nohrian who's turned her back on King Garon's atrocities.

intro.speaker: Felicia
intro.line: If you had, you'd know that Corrin is just trying to follow the path of justice! So, even though it means fighting against my own sister and tribe... I stand with Lord/Lady Corrin.

intro.speaker: Flora
intro.line: I wish I had your strength...

intro.speaker: Felicia
intro.line: You do! You can still do the right thing!

intro.speaker: Flora
intro.line: No! Forget what I said. This has gone on long enough. I'm going to end it quickly.

intro.speaker: Felicia
intro.line: Please, no!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Flora, I still believe in you! I know that King Garon must have something over you. But if we stick together, I promise we have the strength to take him on. Flora! Are you listening?

visit.speaker: Boy
visit.line: I've got nothing for you. Go ahead and kill me if you must! You should give up now, though. Do you even realize you're surrounded?

visit.speaker: Old Man
visit.line: Nothing but old bones and dust in this house, youngster. All I can offer is a warning—our soldiers love hiding in the snow!

visit.speaker: Child
visit.line: People in town are saying you're the bad guys...but I don't know what to think. I've seen some of those Nohr soldiers doing awful things to our people. Here, take this. It's not much, but it's all I can give. I just ask that you spare Flora and the other locals. Good luck!

visit.speaker: Girl
visit.line: Why did you have to come here and make all this fuss? Well, no matter. Now that you're here, we can't let any of you leave, I'm afraid.

visit.speaker: Old Woman
visit.line: Ahhh! Get out of here! I don't want any trouble. Hey, soldiers! The invaders are at my front doorstep. COME GET 'EM!

boss.speaker: Corrin
boss.line: Flora! Why are you doing this? Please! There must be a reason.

boss.speaker: Flora
boss.line: I told you already. You betrayed Nohr. Now quit asking about it!

boss.speaker: Flora
boss.line: You don’t even know the real me. Now it’s time for you to die!

boss.speaker: Flora
boss.line: So...they sent you to face me.

boss.speaker: Felicia
boss.line: Sister, I’m here to talk you out of this madness. It’s not too late to change your mind!

boss.speaker: Flora
boss.line: No, I can’t turn back. And I won’t go easy on anyone—not even you.

boss.speaker: Jakob
boss.line: Flora! Stop this madness at once and return to your senses. You've embarrassed me more than enough for one lifetime.

boss.speaker: Flora
boss.line: Jakob... I wish it didn't have to be this way. I wish we could have just stayed in the fortress... Happily serving Lord/Lady Corrin until we were old and gray... We could have had a future together. Just know that I'll always regret this.

boss.speaker: Jakob
boss.line: What? I can't hear you over this ridiculous snowstorm.

boss.speaker: Flora
boss.line: That's just as well. It's fitting that my hopes and dreams should blow away in the wind...

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: You left me no choice, Flora. I've been as merciful as I can be, but I need to hear it from you. What is Garon threatening you with?

end.speaker: Flora
end.line: I...I can't... Ugh. I guess it's all over. I have nothing left to lose, so... Garon said he'd destroy my entire village if I didn't cooperate.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: You see? That's exactly why we must stand against him!

end.speaker: Flora
end.line: But you don't understand! Garon said that if I didn't kill you and Felicia myself...he'd kill everyone in the village and burn it to the ground! I made the toughest choice of my life. To protect many at the expense of a few...

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: But, Flora... How could you be sure Garon would even keep his promise to spare your village?

end.speaker: Flora
end.line: I know...but it was that or risk certain destruction. He gave me 30 seconds to make a decision before killing me on the spot. Being weak and afraid of death...I shamefully decided to betray you.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: None of this is your fault, Flora. I just wish you'd trusted that we could help you...

end.speaker: Flora
end.line: Well, nothing will change the fact that I betrayed you. Not to mention my own flesh and blood. For that...I deserve to die.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Flora. Please don't be so hard on yourself.

end.speaker: Jakob
end.line: Yes. You've been foolish, but we have survived. Now it's time to regroup.

end.speaker: Felicia
end.line: See, Sister? It's all over. All is forgiven. Please come talk to me.

end.speaker: Flora
end.line: Everyone... GET BACK!

end.speaker: Felicia
end.line: Flora...NO!

end.speaker: Jakob
end.line: What in the devil are you doing?

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Oh, gods! No! Flora, what have you done?

end.speaker: Flora
end.line: This is what I should have done the moment Garon threatened me. Perhaps I could have taken him out with me...

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Somebody help! Put out the fire!

end.speaker: Felicia
end.line: Stand back... HAAA!

end.speaker: Felicia
end.line: Oh no... It's not working!

end.speaker: Jakob
end.line: The fire must be enchanted... It's getting even stronger! We need water! Won't someone bring water?

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Flora! You have the power to stop this! PLEASE! DO IT NOW!

end.speaker: Flora
end.line: No, Lord/Lady Corrin. I finally feel at peace.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Please! *sob* Don't do this! We can still save you...

end.speaker: Felicia
end.line: My ice power isn't strong enough to put out the fire... Flora, why won't you listen to reason?

end.speaker: Flora
end.line: Please stop trying to save me. This is what I deserve.

end.speaker: Felicia
end.line: Flora, NO! You can't die like this!

end.speaker: Flora
end.line: Ughh... The end is near... Felicia... Lord/Lady Corrin... I regret...everything. ...

end.speaker: Felicia
end.line: Sister, NO! NOOOOOO! SISTER!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Gods...why... Flora...

end.speaker: Jakob
end.line: What a foolish and terrible waste of life. I think I am going to be sick.

end.speaker: Felicia
end.line: *sob* *sob* Sister...please wake up! Tell me that this is just a bad dream...

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: ... King Garon claims another beautiful life. He...will...PAY! I swear on my own life. We're coming for you, Garon.
